info.title: SWTbahn
info.description: SWTbahn server offering an API for interacting with an SWTbahn model railway.

post.summary: Startup the SWTbahn
post.description: Attempts to start up the SWTbahn to get it running; i.e., initialize connection to hardware, parse config files, and so on. This starts the server session if successful.

500.description: SWTbahn unable to startup due to internal error

post.summary: Shutdown the SWTbahn
post.description: Attempts to shut down the SWTbahn (if it is running); i.e., close connection to hardware, stop running internal threads, and so on. This stops the current server session if successful.

post.summary: Set the track output state
post.description: Set the track output state for all track outputs

requestBody.description: the state that all track outputs shall be set to

post.summary: Set the verification option
post.description: Set the verification option to true or false, i.e., enable or disable the verification of train engines when they are uploaded. Note that verification will only work if a verification url to the swtbahn-verifier (or equivalent) server has been set.

requestBody.description: the new value of the verification option (true or false)

post.summary: Set the verification url
post.description: Set the verification url, i.e., the path for the websocket connection to the verification server for train engines.

requestBody.description: the new value of the verification url (should start with ws://)

post.summary: Release a train
post.description: Force-release a train that is currently grabbed by someone.

400.description: Invalid train, or train not currently grabbed

requestBody.description: the train that shall be released

post.summary: Set the dcc speed of a train
post.description: Set the dcc speed of a train. This is set directly via bidib, i.e., it does not use the train engine dynamic container. Note that this may lead to inconsistencies/the train changing its speed to something else after this command due to a change in the output of the train engine dynamic container.

400.description: Invalid train, invalid speed, or invalid track output

requestBody.description: the train whose speed shall be set, the speed in the range [-126, 126] , and the track output (usually 'master').

post.summary: releases a route
post.description: releases the specified route that is currently granted to a train

requestBody.description: route which shall be released.

post.summary: set the state/aspect of a point

requestBody.description: point whose state shall be set, and state to set.

post.summary: set the state/aspect of a signal

requestBody.description: signal whose state shall be set, and state to set.

post.summary: set the state/aspect of a peripheral

requestBody.description: peripheral whose state shall be set, and state to set.

post.summary: set the interlocker to be used by the SWTbahn

400.description: Invalid or missing parameter or no more free interlocker instances available

requestBody.description: ID of the interlocker to be used by the SWTbahn.

post.summary: unset the interlocker currently used by the SWTbahn

409.description: no interlocker currently set, or currently set interlocker has a different name

requestBody.description: ID of the interlocker currently used by the SWTbahn that shall be unset.

get.summary: get the ID of the interlocker currently used by the SWTbahn

post.summary: grab a train
post.description: Grab a train (to take temporary ownership). If successful, a grab-id (that identifies this temporary ownership) and a session-id (server session ID to detect server restarts which invalidate train ownerships) are returned. The ownership lasts until it is released (by an admin or by the driver), or until the server session ends.

404.description: Unknown train or invalid train state

409.description: Train already grabbed or max. no of grabbed trains reached

requestBody.description:
A train engine ID has to be specified along with the ID of the train to grab.
The train engine determines how the train reacts to speed and direction requests/commands sent via the appropriate API endpoint.
The normal train engine is called 'libtrain_engine_default (unremovable)'.

post.summary: release a train
post.description: Release a train that was grabbed with a specific grab-id in the current server session.

requestBody.description:
The grab-id has to be specified which identifies the train ownership that is to be released.
The session-id has to be specified to make sure this train ownership was granted in the same server session.

post.summary: request a route
post.description: Request a route from a source signal to a destination signal, to be driven with the grabbed train. If successful, a route is granted and its ID is returned.

400.description: Invalid or missing parameter(s), or other reason for no route being granted

409.description: Route to be granted is in conflict with other granted route or in conflict with state of the track

requestBody.description:
The grab-id has to be specified which identifies the train ownership, i.e., the train with which the route is to be driven.
The session-id has to be specified to make sure the train ownership was granted in the same server session.
The source (destination) signal is the start (end) of the desired route. In case of composite signals (two signals on one post/mast), usually the specific ID of the non-distant signal has to be provided.

post.summary: request a route by its ID
post.description: Request the route with a specific route-id, to be driven with the grabbed train. If successful, the route with the specified ID is granted.

400.description: Invalid or missing parameter(s), or other reason for no route being granted

409.description: Route to be granted is in conflict with other granted route or in conflict with state of the track, or route is already granted

requestBody.description:
The grab-id has to be specified which identifies the train ownership, i.e., the train with which the route is to be driven.
The session-id has to be specified to make sure the train ownership was granted in the same server session.
The route-id identifies which route is being requested.

post.summary: get the direction for driving a route
post.description: Get the direction that the specified train would need to drive (forwards or backwards) to drive along the specified route.

requestBody.description: The train for which the direction is to be determined and the route-id of the route for which the driving direction is to be determined.

post.summary: drive a route
post.description:
Drive the specified route with the grabbed train, either in manual mode (speed controlled by driver via separate set-speed commands) or in automatic mode (train is driven automatically along the route).
Note that this request is blocking until the route is released (either manually through appropriate command or automatically when end of the route is reached), or an internal error occurs.
This only works if the route is currently granted to the grabbed train.

requestBody.description:
The session-id of the current server session. 
The grab-id that identifies the ownership of the train with which the route is driven.
The route-id that identifies the route to drive.
The mode that specifies whether driving is manual or automatic.

post.summary: set the dcc speed of a train
post.description: Set the requested speed (and thus also direction) of the grabbed train to a valid dcc speed. The speed request is passed to the train engine dynamic container.

requestBody.description:
The session-id of the current server session. 
The grab-id that identifies the ownership of the train whose speed is to be set.
The dcc speed to set.
The track output for which the train shall be set to the given speed (usually 'master').

post.summary: set the speed of a train to a calibrated level
post.description: Sets the speed of the grabbed train to a calibrated level (levels defined in config files)(and thus also direction). In contrast to driver-set-dcc-train-speed, this bypasses the train engine dynamic container, i.e., the speed is set directly via bidib. Note that this may lead to inconsistencies/the train changing its speed to something else after this command due to a change in the output of the train engine dynamic container.

requestBody.description:
The session-id of the current server session. 
The grab-id that identifies the ownership of the train whose speed is to be set.
The calibrated speed level to set.
The track output for which the train shall be set to the given speed (usually 'master').

post.summary: set a train to emergency stop
post.description: Emergency stops the grabbed train. This bypasses the train engine dynamic container, i.e., the emergency stop is set directly via bidib. Note that this may lead to inconsistencies/the train starting to drive again after the emergency stop due to a change in the output of the train engine dynamic container.

requestBody.description:
The session-id of the current server session. 
The grab-id that identifies the ownership of the train which is to be stopped.
The track output for which the train shall be stopped (usually 'master').

post.summary: set the state of a train peripheral
post.description: Set the state of the peripheral of the grabbed train

requestBody.description:
The session-id of the current server session. 
The grab-id that identifies the ownership of the train whose peripheral is to be set.
The peripheral whose state to set.
The state to set the peripheral to (string with '0' or '1' for on or off respectively).
The track output for which the train's peripheral shall be set (usually 'master').
